[[Superman (comic book)|Superman]] }} '''Jack Herbert''' (born February 28, 1982), '''Jackson Herbert Santos de Sousa''' also known as '''Jackson Herbert''', is a Brazilian [[comic book]] artist whose published work includes interior illustrations and cover arts. He entered the industry in 2005 when he was selected by an agency to work in the U.S. market. He is known for the Kirby Genesis{{cite web |url= http://comicbookroundup.com/comic-books/reviews/dynamite-entertainment/kirby-genesis/0|title= Kirby: Genesis #0 |first= Comic|last= Book|date= May 25, 2011|publisher= [[Comic Book Roundup]]|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170204071100/http://comicbookroundup.com/comic-books/reviews/dynamite-entertainment/kirby-genesis/0|archivedate=February 4, 2017 |deadurl= no}}{{cite web |url= http://www.comicscube.com/2011/05/comics-cube-reviews-kirby-genesis-0.html|title= Comics Cube! Reviews: KIRBY: GENESIS #0 |first= Duy|last= Tano|date= May 26, 2011|publisher= [[Comics Cube Review]]|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170204071400/http://www.comicscube.com/2011/05/comics-cube-reviews-kirby-genesis-0.html|archivedate=February 4, 2017 |deadurl= no}} series in which he has worked with the best-selling and Eisner award winners, [[Kurt Busiek]]{{cite web |url= http://www.hahnlibrary.net/comics/awards/eisner99.php|title= 1999 Will Eisner Comic Industry Award Nominees and Winners|publisher= Hahn Library Comic Book Awards Almanac|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20120725160018/http://www.hahnlibrary.net/comics/awards/eisner99.php|archivedate= July 25, 2012|deadurl= no}} and [[Alex Ross]]{{cite web |url= http://www.comic-con.org/awards/1990s-recipients|title= 1990s Eisner Award Recipients|year= 2013|publisher= [[San Diego Comic-Con International]]|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20131029200617/http://www.comic-con.org/awards/1990s-recipients|archivedate= October 29, 2013|deadurl= no|accessdate= February 1, 2014}} and for his contributions to various [[Dynamite Entertainment|Dynamite]] and [[DC Comics]] titles. == Early life == Jack was born on February 28, 1982 in [[Bananeiras]], Paraíba where he lived a "typical middle-class childhood". He became interested in drawing from early childhood and at age of nine, an aunt showed him an interview with [[Mike Deodato]] in the local newspaper, what caused him great impact because Deodato also lived in Paraíba and drew for the great American publishers. Jack explains, ''"And that's when I discovered that I could live with comics, work with comics. So it was from there that I came to believe."''.{{cite web |url= http://espaco-experimental.blogspot.com.br/2014/02/jackson-herbert-i-ed-122014.html|title= Jackson Herbert – I|first= Amanda|last= Félix|date= February 1, 2014|publisher= Espaço Experimental|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170204082200/http://espaco-experimental.blogspot.com.br/2014/02/jackson-herbert-i-ed-122014.html|archivedate=February 4, 2017 |deadurl= no|quote= E foi quando eu descobri que dava pra viver de quadrinhos, trabalhar com quadrinhos. Então, foi a partir daí que eu passei a acreditar.}} At age 10, his family moved to [[João Pessoa, Paraíba|João Pessoa]] where he lives until now. In the 90's, he was first influenced by superheroes when he discovered [[Jim Lee]]'s [[X-Men: Legacy|X-Men]] and the TV serie [[X-Men (TV series)|X-Men: Animated Series]]. He also would later be influenced by comics artists such as [[Mike Deodato]], [[Lee Bermejo]], [[Eduardo Risso]], [[José Luis García-López]], [[Frank Frazetta]], [[Esad Ribić|Esad Ribic]], [[John Buscema]], [[Marc Silvestri]] and [[Olivier Coipel]]{{cite journal|last= Felga|first = Coveiro|title= Jackson Herbert Interview|journal= Universo Marvel 616|issue = |pages= |publisher= [[Universo Marvel 616]]|date= February 7, 2010|url = http://www.marvel616.com/2010/02/616-entrevista-jackson-hebert.html|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170204070126/http://www.marvel616.com/2010/02/616-entrevista-jackson-hebert.html|archivedate= February 4, 2017 |deadurl= no|quote= Minhas principais influencias foram Jim Lee, Greg Capullo e Mark Silvestri. Atualmente tenho influências de Mike Deodato jr., Brian Hitch, Lee Bermejo, Frank Frazetta e Ivan Reis...Conheci o pessoal do Made in PB no ano 2000...e até hoje sou membro efetivo do grupo...eu ja estava com o pessoal do Made in PB nessa época, e tive acesso a essa palestra}} At age 18, he joined the group of designers of a local studio and began doing freelance commercial art jobs and participating in local art events.{{cite journal|last= Vieira|first = Antônio|title= Semana Nacional de Quadrinhos 2017|journal= Jornal da Paraíba|issue = |pages= |publisher= TV Cabo Branco|date= January 30, 2017|url = http://g1.globo.com/pb/paraiba/bom-dia-pb/videos/t/edicoes/v/veja-como-foi-o-encerramento-da-semana-nacional-de-quadrinhos-em-joao-pessoa/5612091/|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170205170100/http://g1.globo.com/pb/paraiba/bom-dia-pb/videos/t/edicoes/v/veja-como-foi-o-encerramento-da-semana-nacional-de-quadrinhos-em-joao-pessoa/5612091/|archivedate= February 5, 2017 |deadurl= no}} In October 2000, he attended a lecture on American comics industry and have his artworks evaluated for the first time. From then on, he focused on the goal of becoming a professional comics artist. At the suggestion of his parents, he graduated on Business Administration{{cite journal|last= Sadovski|first = Roberto|title= Comix Show #02 – Jack Herbert|journal= Conexão Comix|issue = 02|pages= |publisher= Comix Book Shop|date= September 11, 2015|url = http://blog.comix.com.br/comix-show-02-jack-herbert/|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170204201026/http://blog.comix.com.br/comix-show-02-jack-herbert/|archivedate= February 4, 2017 |deadurl= no|quote= Me formei em Administração.}} in 2006, but always continued with his studies on drawing and comics. In 2005, Jack was awarded as penciler at the VII Salão de Novos Artistas Plásticos and at the Wizard Brazil's National Contest.{{cite web|url=http://artesvisuaisparaiba.com.br/artistas/j-medeiros/|title=Jackson Herbert|publisher=Dicionários das Artes Visuais na Paraíba|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170204073100/http://artesvisuaisparaiba.com.br/artistas/j-medeiros/|archivedate=February 4, 2017|deadurl=no}} He's member of the Academy of Letters and Arts of the Northeast of Brazil (ALANE/PB) since 2014. == Career == At the end of 2005, Jack submitted some drawings to Glass House Graphics and after it has passed the 3-stages-evaluation process, he was selected to work in the US market. === Dynamite Entertainment (2006 - 2014) === During the first three years of his career (2006-2008), He started doing the covers and then the interiors of the horror series Echoes of Dawn, published by Trepidation Comics{{cite web |url= https://trepidationcomics.com/titles/echoes-of-dawn/|title= Echoes of Dawn|publisher= Trepidation Comics|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170204095200/https://trepidationcomics.com/titles/echoes-of-dawn/|archivedate=February 4, 2017 |deadurl= no}} and the one-shot [[Painkiller Jane]] #01{{cite web|url=http://jackh3rb3rt.blogspot.com.br/2007/06/painkiller-jane-trabalho-feito-para.html |title=Painkiller Jane |publisher=Jack Herbert |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170206070400/http://jackh3rb3rt.blogspot.com.br/2007/06/painkiller-jane-trabalho-feito-para.html |archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl=no |df= }}{{cite web |url= http://jackh3rb3rt.blogspot.com.br/2007/07/painkiller-jane-pgs-1-e-2.html|title= Painkiller Jane|publisher= Jack Herbert|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206070500/http://jackh3rb3rt.blogspot.com.br/2007/07/painkiller-jane-pgs-1-e-2.html|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} for [[Dynamite Entertainment]]. he also worked on the series [[Battlestar Galactica (comics)|New Battlestar Galactica Season Zero]]{{cite web |url= http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?CAT=DF-Battlestar_Galactica_Season_Zero|title= New Battlestar Galactica Season Zero|publisher= Dynamite Entertainment|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206071000/http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?CAT=DF-Battlestar_Galactica_Season_Zero|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} with writer [[Brandon Jerwa]]. Jack penciled and inked the entire series, with the exception of the first edition, and also illustrated some covers. That series became his first known work. In 2009, he worked for [[Marvel Comics]] in an one-shot comic based on the American TV series [[Jesse James Is a Dead Man|Jesse James is a Dead Man]]{{cite web |url= https://www.comicburst.com/jesse-james-is-a-dead-man-custom-comic-nn-635758-1-9022-nn.html|title= Jesse James is a Dead Man|publisher= Comic Burst|archiveurl= and in [[Avengers/Invaders|Avengers Invaders]] #11 e #12 among [[Alex Ross]], Steve Sadowski and writer [[Jim Krueger]].{{cite web |url= http://www.ign.com/articles/2007/08/11/interview-alex-ross-returns-to-marvel|title= Interview: Alex Ross Returns to Marvel|first= Richard|last= George|date= August 11, 2007|publisher= IGN|archiveurl= http://www.comicbookresources.com/?page=article&id=11195|title= Ross' Return = ''Avengers/Invaders''|first= Jonah|last= Weiland|date= August 14, 2007|publisher=Comic Book Resources|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206073400/https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/12721857-avengers-invaders|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} As soon as he finished that job, Dynamite offered him an exclusive contract until 2014. In that same year, he joined the special [[Project Superpowers]] series plotted by [[Alex Ross]] and scripted by [[Joe Casey]] and illustrated Meet the Bad Guys #4 [[Scarab (Dynamite Entertainment)|The Scarab Supremacy]],{{cite web |url= http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?PRO=C725130129864|title= PROJECT SUPERPOWERS: MEET THE BAD GUYS #4 (OF 4)|publisher= Dynamite Entertainment|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206073400/http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?PRO=C725130129864|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} colored by [[Marcelo Maiolo]]. ==== Red Sonja Series ==== In the early 2000's, Dynamite acquired the comic book rights to Red Sonja and decided to bring back Sonja’s classic bikini armor for her new series, which debuted in 2005. The series was an immediate hit, becoming Dynamite’s best-selling title and firmly returning Red Sonja to mainstream popularity. The character now has a monthly series, together with a series of mini-series and one-shots, all published by Dynamite Entertainment. The main Red Sonja series features a number of cover artists as well as the regular team of writer [[Michael Avon Oeming]] and artist [[Mel Rubi]].{{cite web |url= http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/infoDB.html?show=NS07100958035|title= Red Sonja|publisher= Dynamite Entertainment|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170209220400/http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/infoDB.html?show=NS07100958035|archivedate=February 9, 2017 |deadurl= no}} Jack Herbert did cover work for that series in the issues [[Red Sonja]] #41–45 and also for [[Red Sonja|Queen Sonja]] #1–5. During the year 2010, Jack Herbert worked in the title Queen Sonja making full pencils, inks and covers.{{cite web |url= http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?PRO=C725130138705|title= Queen Sonja #6|publisher= Dynamite Entertainment|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206074200/http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?PRO=C725130138705|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} In 2011, when he was working in [[Black Terror]] #12,13 and 14 with Alex Ross and [[Phil Hester (comics)|Phil Hester]].{{cite web |url= http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?PRO=C725130146908|title= Black Terror #12|publisher= Dynamite Entertainment|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206074400/http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?PRO=C725130146908|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} Alex was looking for an artist to work with him on Kirby Genesis Project and had already done some testing, but he liked Jack's art so much that invited him for pencils and inks. Kirby Genesis{{cite web |url= http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?CAT=DF-Kirby_Genesis|title= Kirby Genesis|publisher= Dynamite Entertainment|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206074400/http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?CAT=DF-Kirby_Genesis|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} is a series with 9 hardcover books based on the concepts and characters of the great [[Jack Kirby]] and was published during 2011 and 2012. The project had the script done by [[Kurt Busiek]], arts by [[Alex Ross]] and Jack Herbert and colors by Vinícius Andrade. This became the best-known work of Jack Herbert in the comic book market until then and is considered by him, his most important work.{{cite journal|last= Félix|first = Amanda|title= Jackson Herbert – II (ed. 1/2/2014)|journal= Espaço Experimental|issue = 02|pages= |publisher= Comix Book Shop|date= February 1, 2014|url = http://espaco-experimental.blogspot.com.br/2014/02/jackson-herbert-ii-ed-122014.html/}}{{dead link|date=May 2017|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}{{cite web |url= https://studiomadeinpb.wordpress.com/tag/jack-herbert/|title= Jackson Herbert|publisher= Studio Made in PB|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170205142200/https://studiomadeinpb.wordpress.com/tag/jack-herbert/|archivedate=February 5, 2017 |deadurl= no}} After Kirby Genesis, Jack was responsible for the interiors of the pulp series [[Black Fury (comics)|Miss Fury]],{{cite web |url= http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?PRO=C72513020398400111|title= Miss Fury #1|publisher= Dynamite Entertainment|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206074900/http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?PRO=C72513020398400111|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} that was published in the years of 2013 and 2014. In the last two years in Dynamite, he has also worked on the titles like [[The Shadow]]{{cite web |url= http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?PRO=C72513018928800711|title= The Shadow #7|publisher= Dynamite Entertainment|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206075100/http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?PRO=C72513018928800711|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} and [[The Six Million Dollar Man|The Bionic Man]] vs [[The Bionic Woman]].{{cite web |url= http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?PRO=C72513020061700111|title= The Bionic Man vs The Bionic Woman #1|publisher= Dynamite Entertainment|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206075300/http://www.dynamite.com/htmlfiles/viewProduct.html?PRO=C72513020061700111|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} === DC Comics (2014 - until now) === In 2014, Jack is called to pencil [[Superman/Batman|Batman/Superman]]: Futures End #1{{cite web |url= http://batman-news.com/2014/09/19/batmansuperman-futures-end-1-review/|title= Batman Superman: Futures End #1 - Review|publisher= Barman News|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206115800/http://batman-news.com/2014/09/19/batmansuperman-futures-end-1-review/|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} with [[Cliff Richards]] and Vicente Cifuentes and [[Superman]] #31{{cite web |url= http://www.cbr.com/superman-31/|title= Superman #31 - Review|publisher= CBR|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206120200/http://www.cbr.com/superman-31/|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} with [[Ed Benes]], his firsts works for [[DC Comics]] as regular artist of the publisher. After that, he was the penciler of [[Jason Todd|Red Hood]] chapter in [[Secret Origins]] #5.{{cite web |url= http://batman-news.com/2014/08/27/secret-origins-5-review/|title= Secret Origins #5 - Review|publisher= Batman News|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206120300/http://batman-news.com/2014/08/27/secret-origins-5-review/|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} He then shares with Ken Lashley the art in [[Superman: Doomed]] # 2.{{cite web |url= http://www.cbr.com/superman-doomed-2/|title= Superman: Doomed #2|publisher= CBR|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206120800/http://www.cbr.com/superman-doomed-2/|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} Still in 2014, his participation in [[Superman/Wonder Woman]] #12{{cite web |url= http://www.dccomics.com/comics/superman-wonder-woman-2013/supermanwonder-woman-12|title= Superman Wonder Woman #12|publisher= DC Comics|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206121000/http://www.dccomics.com/comics/superman-wonder-woman-2013/supermanwonder-woman-12|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} was marked by the hugging scene between Superman and Wonder Woman in a football stadium that is shared by many fans of the power couple on the internet. In the next year, Jack contributes as penciller in six editions of [[Kingdom Come (comics)|Earth 2]]: World's End and in [[The New 52: Futures End|The New 52 Futures End]] #45{{cite web |url= http://all-comic.com/2015/new-52-futures-end-45/|title= The New 52: Futures End #45|publisher= All-Comic.com|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206121500/http://all-comic.com/2015/new-52-futures-end-45/|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} with several other artists like: Thompson, Cifuentes, Lemire and Jurgens. In late 2015, while drawing the pages for Titans Hunt #3,{{cite web |url= http://www.weirdsciencedccomics.com/2015/12/titans-hunt-3-review-and-spoilers.html|title= Titans Hunt #3 - Review and Spoilers|publisher= Weird Science|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206122100/http://www.weirdsciencedccomics.com/2015/12/titans-hunt-3-review-and-spoilers.html|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} his art earned him praise from [[Jim Lee]] due to light composition. Jack met Jim Lee personally at CCXP that year in São Paulo. In that issue, he shared the pencils with Paulo Siqueira and Geraldo Borges. In 2006, DC Comics started a Rebirth. [[DC Rebirth]] restored the [[DC Universe]] to a form much like that prior to the "Flashpoint" storyline while still incorporating numerous elements of [[The New 52]], including its continuity. In this year, Jack works in the Rebirth titles: [[Green Lantern Corps|Green Lanterns Corps]] Edge of Oblivion #6{{cite web |url= http://www.dccomics.com/comics/green-lantern-corps-edge-of-oblivion-2016/green-lantern-corps-edge-of-oblivion-6|title= Green Lanterns Corps: Edge of Oblivion #6|publisher= DC Comics|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206122600/http://www.dccomics.com/comics/green-lantern-corps-edge-of-oblivion-2016/green-lantern-corps-edge-of-oblivion-6|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} with writer Tom Taylor and colorist Hi-Fi, [[Green Lantern]]s #6{{cite web |url= http://www.dccomics.com/comics/green-lanterns-2016/green-lanterns-6|title= Green Lanterns #6|publisher= DC Comics|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206122300/http://www.dccomics.com/comics/green-lanterns-2016/green-lanterns-6|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} and #7{{cite web |url= http://www.dccomics.com/comics/green-lanterns-2016/green-lanterns-7|title= Green Lanterns #7|publisher= DC Comics|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170206122300/http://www.dccomics.com/comics/green-lanterns-2016/green-lanterns-7|archivedate=February 6, 2017 |deadurl= no}} with plot of [[Sam Humphries]] and sharing pencils with Will Conrad, and in [[Batman/Superman/Wonder Woman: Trinity|Trinity]] #3 as fill in, but his pages weren't published. Jack is currently working with writer [[Phil Jimenez]] on [[Superwoman]] and colorist Hi-Fi. His art appears in the series from issue #6.{{cite web |url= http://www.cbr.com/superwoman-6/|title= Superwoman #6 (Preview)|publisher= CBR|archiveurl=
